Articles.Content: <figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480" alt="image" src="https://41.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_nq06va0jC21rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="802" data-orig-width="968"><img data-orig-height="802" data-orig-width="968" alt="image" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/e097308f331e4bf71f6531951b5ed001/tumblr_inline_nq06v0yr0G1rr2wit_540.png"/></figure><p>This contract pack was created by Whitecat106 and contains 391 new contracts for your career mode. The contracts will offer you a progression that mimics that of the human spaceflight history, launching such missions as the Vostok, MIR, Venera and the ISS.</p><p>Definitely <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123453"><b>worth a look</b></a> if you’re looking to learn more about human spaceflight history!</p>
Ooooohhhh! I like the looks of this!

I will definitely try this out. Looks like a great idea. Hopefully it's not too repetitive like the stock system...

[sCENE: KSC - Apollo 11 astronauts exiting isolation trailer - close up dialogue...]

NASA Chief Admin: "Neil, Buzz - Welcome back. Remember that flag planting thing you did a few weeks ago?"

Neil, Buzz: "Uh, yea - what about it?"

NASA Chief Admin: "Well, see... there's a whole group of subcontractors that want you to go back right away and do it for each of them individually."

Neil, Buzz: "?"

NASA Chief Admin: "Yes, we want you to return to the moon now and stay there. Just pop out from time-to-time and plant the flag. Heck just keep using the same one over and over - we don't care."

Neil, Buz: "OK sure. But when can we come home?"

NASA Chief Admin: "We'll get back to you on that. Oh, look! Bunt cake!!!"

Pete, Alan: "Bastages!"

EDIT: I've downloaded the mod and yes, it seems rather good. Looking forward to further exploring it.

Edited June 16, 2015 by Wallygator
Tell me why all I can think of looking at this great mod is, "NASA worm logo! Must download!"
